newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai stocks close slightly up after listless day.
newsitem.headline: Thai stocks close slightly up after listless day.

text.p: Thai stocks edged slightly higher Monday after a flat day's trade saw most investors sidelined pending a policy statement by Finance Minister Amnuay Viravan and a meeting on US interest rates tomorrow, brokers said.
The SET Index rose 0.09 points to close at 872.76. The SET-50 closed up 66.26 up 0.07 points on trade worth 2.368 billion baht.
"It was very quiet today, what interest there was seemed to be local," said a senior trader at Dynamic Eastern.
"I think we were waiting for the Fed meeting, if it doesn't change tomorrow, and I don't think it will, we might see the SET up a little," he said.
The US Federal Reserve Open Market Committee meets tomorrow to reassess US interest rates to which Thailand is especially sensitive given its rising current account deficit.
Few surprises are expected from a policy statement by Thai finance minister Amnuay Viravan tomorrow but with the Index near 42 month lows investors were not taking chances, traders said.
Among top stocks Krung Thai Bank lost 0.50 baht to 61.00, Thai Telephone shed 3.25 to 30.50 and IFCT put on two to 76.
